wikipedia_page.main: James David Lee Nicholson (31 January 1938 – 8 January 1967) was a British rower. He competed in the men's coxless pair event at the 1964 Summer Olympics. He represented Britain in the inaugural 1962 World Rowing Championships with Stewart Farquharson in the coxless pairs, in which they won the B final.He also represented England and won a gold medal in the coxless pair with Stewart Farquharson, at the 1962 British Empire and Commonwealth Games in Perth, Western Australia. They both rowed for the University of London Boat Club at the time.

response: *Coxless pair - David Lee Nicholson and Stewart Farquharson  - Fourth

link_mentions.page: England at the 1962 British Empire and Commonwealth Games

response: Stewart Farquharson (born 27 April 1940) is a British rower. He competed at the 1960 Summer Olympics and the 1964 Summer Olympics. He represented Britain in the inaugural 1962 World Rowing Championships with David Lee Nicholson in the coxless pairs, in which they won the B final.

He also represented England and won a gold medal in the coxless pair with David Lee Nicholson, at the 1962 British Empire and Commonwealth Games in Perth, Western Australia. They both rowed for the University of London Boat Club at the time.
